options.name: configText
options.desc: Verbatim contents of smb.conf. If null (default), use theautogenerated file from NixOS instead.

options.name: enable
options.desc: Whether to enable Samba, which provides file and print services toWindows clients through the SMB/CIFS protocol.   If you use the firewall consider adding the following:   services.samba.openFirewall = true;

options.name: enableNmbd
options.desc: Whether to enable Samba’s nmbd, which replies to NetBIOS over IP nameservice requests. It also participates in the browsing protocols whichmake up the Windows “Network Neighborhood” view.

options.name: enableWinbindd
options.desc: Whether to enable Samba’s winbindd, which provides a number ofservices to the Name Service Switch capability found in most modern Clibraries, to arbitrary applications via PAM and ntlm_auth and to Sambaitself.

options.name: extraConfig
options.desc: Additional global section and extra section lines go in here.

options.name: invalidUsers
options.desc: List of users who are denied to login via Samba.

options.name: nsswins
options.desc: Whether to enable the WINS NSS (Name Service Switch) plug-in.Enabling it allows applications to resolve WINS/NetBIOS names (a.k.a.Windows machine names) by transparently querying the winbindddaemon.

options.name: openFirewall
options.desc: Whether to automatically open the necessary ports in thefirewall.

options.name: shares
options.desc: A set describing shared resources. See  man smb.conf  for options.
options.type: attribute set of attribute set of unspecified value
